sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a circle.
message_1: A circle has a diameter of 10 cm. What is the perimeter of the circle?
message_2:
To find the perimeter (circumference) of a circle, we use the formula:

C = πd

where C is the circumference, π (pi) is approximately 3.14159, and d is the diameter.

In this case, the diameter (d) is 10 cm. So, we can plug this value into the formula:

C = π(10 cm)
C ≈ 3.14159 × 10 cm
C ≈ 31.4159 cm

The perimeter (circumference) of the circle is approximately 31.4159 cm.
